item.title: 维托尔公司首席执行官称，对欧洲来说，零净排放可能是一个代价太高的目标
item.description: 全球最大的独立石油贸易商负责人表示，欧洲各国政府应该实事求是地考虑消费者和工业界因追求严格的净零排放目标而付出的代价。【原文：European governments should be realistic about the costs to consumers and industry from pursuing strict net-zero emissions goals, according to the head of the world’s biggest independent oil trader.】

item.title: 欧洲洋流变暖本世纪 "不太可能 "崩溃
item.description:
据科学家称，大西洋经向翻转环流即将减弱，但不太可能突然停止，这将使欧洲避免惊人的气温下降。【原文：

The Atlantic Meridional Overturning Circulation is due to weaken but unlikely to stop abruptly, sparing Europe a startling temperature drop, according to scientists.

】

item.title: 德国复兴信贷银行向开普敦提供 1.5 亿欧元绿色能源贷款
item.description: 在获得德国复兴信贷银行（KFW）1.5 亿欧元（1.57 亿美元）贷款后，开普敦将加快向绿色能源的转变，并限制对国家电力公司不稳定供应的依赖。【原文：Cape Town is set to accelerate its switch to green energy and limit reliance on erratic supply from the state power utility after winning a €150 million ($157 million) loan from Germany’s KFW Development Bank.】

item.title: 热带风暴加剧，毛里求斯将关闭机场
item.description: 毛里求斯气象部门在今年夏季首次将气旋预警提升至三级，毛里求斯唯一的机场计划从周三晚上开始关闭，直至另行通知。【原文：The sole airport in Mauritius is scheduled to shut down from Wednesday evening until further notice after the country’s meteorological services raised a cyclone warning to Class III for the first time in the current summer season.】

item.title: 特朗普的环保局计划对美国气候变化规则实施单一打击
item.description: 唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）总统的最高环境监管机构正在建议美国政府取消其关于温室气体危及公众的正式结论，此举将扫除限制发电厂、汽车和油井造成的地球变暖污染的法规的法律基础。【原文：President Donald Trump’s top environmental regulator is recommending the US government scrap its formal conclusion that greenhouse gases endanger the public, a move that would sweep away the legal foundation for regulations limiting planet-warming pollution from power plants, automobiles and oil wells.】

item.title: GE Vernova 和 NRG 将为人工智能建造 5 千兆瓦天然气发电厂
item.description: GE Vernova 公司、NRG 能源公司和 Kiewit 公司签署了一项协议，将开发多达 5.4 千兆瓦的燃气发电厂，因为能源行业预计人工智能将导致电力需求激增。【原文：GE Vernova Inc., NRG Energy Inc. and Kiewit Corp. have signed an agreement to develop up to 5.4 gigawatts of gas-fired power plants as the energy industry anticipates a surge in electricity demand from artificial intelligence.】

item.title: 希思罗机场支持里夫斯关于在 2029 年之前开始修建新跑道的呼吁
item.description: 伦敦希思罗机场对英国政府提出的在 2029 年下届大选前开始建设第三条跑道的目标表示赞同，称英国财政大臣雷切尔-里夫斯提出的时间表是 "可行的"。【原文：London Heathrow Airport endorsed the UK government’s target of starting construction on a third runway before the next election in 2029, saying the timeline put forward by Chancellor of the Exchequer Rachel Reeves is “doable.”】

item.title: 洛杉矶火险四伏，但向居民发出的信号喜忧参半
item.description:
最近的野火摧毁了位于政府危险区之外的数千栋房屋。【原文：

The recent wildfires destroyed thousands of homes that sat outside government hazard zones. 

】

item.title: 特朗普终止美国促进非洲电力供应的倡议
item.description: 据熟悉内情的人士透露，美国一项旨在增加非洲电力供应的计划在经过十多年的努力后，已被特朗普政府取消。【原文：A US initiative to increase electricity supply in Africa has been dismantled by the Trump administration after more than a decade of work, according to people familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 随着汽油价格上涨，中国电动汽车在尼日利亚取得进展
item.description:
电动汽车的运行成本正逐渐低于汽油车。只有一个小插曲：这个非洲国家已经在为电力供应不稳定而苦苦挣扎。【原文：

Electric cars are becoming cheaper to run than gas guzzlers. There’s just one hiccup: The African country is already struggling with erratic power supply.

】

item.title: 欧洲银行警告环境、社会和公司治理的突然撤退隐藏着信用风险
item.description: 欧洲银行业联合会警告说，拟议中的集团环境、社会和公司治理（ESG）规则的倒退规模之大，将使贷款人更难分析信贷风险。【原文：The European Banking Federation is warning that the sheer scale of a proposed rollback of the bloc’s ESG rules will make it harder for lenders to analyze credit risk.】

item.title: 欧盟将向在竞争中挣扎的行业推介清洁新政
item.description: 欧盟将公布一项提高欧盟竞争力的计划，因为欧盟各行业正在努力平衡雄心勃勃的气候目标和来自美国和中国日益激烈的竞争。【原文：The European Union will unveil a plan to improve the bloc’s competitiveness as its industries struggle to balance ambitious climate targets and increasing rivalry from the US and China.】

item.title: 中国必须削减 15%的钢铁产能才能实现 2025 年气候目标
item.description: 据清洁能源分析师称，如果钢厂要实现 2025 年的气候目标并恢复盈利，中国需要在今年削减 15%的产能，以解决钢铁过剩问题。【原文：China needs to tackle its steel glut by cutting 15% of capacity this year, if mills are to meet their 2025 climate goals and return to profitability, according to clean energy analysts.】

item.title: 英国气候顾问的碳计划为希思罗机场的发展扫清了道路
item.description: 英国气候监督机构发布了对政府去碳化战略的新建议，其中包括提高航空客运量的预测，这有助于为伦敦希思罗机场的扩建计划铺平道路。【原文：The UK’s climate watchdog has released new recommendations for the government’s decarbonization strategy that include higher projections for airline passenger numbers, helping smooth the way for plans to expand London’s Heathrow Airport.】

item.title: 气候多变导致气象机构在厄尔尼诺信息传递上出现分歧
item.description:
准确的解读对于政府、能源市场和农民来说至关重要，尤其是在全球变暖加剧极端天气的情况下。【原文：

An accurate read is essential for governments, energy markets and farmers, especially as global warming exacerbates extreme weather.

】

item.title: 大型树木供应商将破产归咎于加州干旱
item.description: 一家在家居装饰店销售树木和植物的主要供应商已申请破产，将其财务困境归咎于南加州的干旱状况以及最近的潮湿天气。【原文：A major supplier of trees and plants sold at home improvement stores has filed bankruptcy, blaming its financial trouble on drought conditions in Southern California followed by more recent wet weather.】

item.title: 德国大力发展绿色电力，预计到 2026 年底将降低电价
item.description: 据市场分析师称，德国推动建设更多可再生能源发电设施的举措将在明年年底前开始降低电力批发价格。【原文：A push to build more renewable generation in Germany will begin to bring down wholesale power prices by the end of next year, according to market analysts.】

item.title: 特朗普对电动卡车规则的威胁破坏了大集团的赌注
item.description:
严格的车辆电气化法规摇摇欲坠，阻碍了清洁经济中最肮脏行业之一的努力。【原文：

Stringent electrification regulations for the vehicles are teetering, hampering efforts to clean up one of the economy’s dirtiest sectors.

】

item.title: 印度酝酿 10 亿美元补贴计划以促进太阳能制造
item.description: 据知情人士透露，印度正在敲定一项 10 亿美元的资本补贴计划，以支持其太阳能制造业，这也是印度为减少对中国的依赖并从全球能源转型中获利而做出的更广泛努力的一部分。【原文：India is finalizing a $1 billion capital subsidy plan to bolster its solar manufacturing industry, according to people with knowledge of the matter, as part of a wider effort to reduce dependence on China and profit from the global energy transition.】

item.title: 欧洲电动汽车销量激增 37%，汽车制造商推动制定更宽松的二氧化碳法规
item.description: 上个月，欧洲电动汽车销量增长了 37%，原因是汽车制造商为遵守今年更严格的排放法规而大力推广其电池动力汽车。【原文：Europe’s electric-vehicle sales rose 37% last month as automakers promoted their battery-powered cars in order to comply with tighter emissions regulation this year.】

item.title: 伍德赛德公司表示，碳信用额是遏制排放的必要条件
item.description: 伍德赛德能源集团有限公司（Woodside Energy Group Ltd.）认为碳信用额仍可发挥作用，因为解决难以消减的排放预计需要成本。【原文：Woodside Energy Group Ltd. sees a continued role for carbon credits because of the projected costs of tackling difficult-to-abate emissions.】

item.title: 美国农业部因清除气候变化信息面临诉讼
item.description: 美国农业部在其网站上删除有关气候变化的信息，此举正面临法律挑战。【原文：The US Department of Agriculture is facing a legal challenge over its move to wipe out information on climate change from its websites.】

item.title: 欧盟在受到强烈批评后从环境、社会和治理议程中大举撤退
item.description: 有大量抱怨称，ESG 法规正成为阻碍欧盟与美国和亚洲竞争的绊脚石，因此欧盟即将收回大量计划中的 ESG 法规。【原文：The European Union is about to walk back significant chunks of planned ESG regulations, amid a barrage of complaints that such rules are becoming a dead weight hampering EU efforts to compete with the US and Asia.】

item.title: 法国希望欧盟给予汽车制造商排放灵活性
item.description: 法国希望欧盟给予该地区的汽车制造商更多的灵活性，以遵守今年的排放目标，因为他们担心如果达不到目标可能会面临罚款。【原文：France wants the European Union to give the region’s carmakers more flexibility to comply with emissions targets this year amid concerns that they could face fines for missing goals.】

item.title: 无人驾驶作物喷粉机提供更安全的新型耕作方式
item.description:
初创公司 Pyka 的电动飞机正在拉丁美洲的香蕉种植园中使用，以减少化学品的传播和排放。【原文：

Startup Pyka’s electric aircraft are being used on banana plantations across Latin America in a bid to reduce the spread of chemicals and cut emissions.

】

item.title: 陷入僵局的联合国自然谈判将在罗马重启，进行为期三天的冲刺
item.description:
在去年的缔约方大会第十六届会议陷入僵局之后，谈判代表将第二次尝试就阻止全球生物多样性丧失的资金问题达成一致。【原文：

After last year’s COP16 reached an impasse, negotiators will make a second attempt to agree on funding to halt the global loss of biodiversity. 

】

item.title: 马来西亚棕榈树洪灾问题将再持续一个月
item.description: 据一位业内高级官员称，马来西亚油棕种植园今年被雨水淹没，至少在一个月内产量不可能恢复。【原文：Malaysian oil palm plantations that have been inundated with rain this year aren’t likely to see production recover for at least another month, according to a senior industry official.】

item.title: 特朗普为全球引用最多的气候报告带来不确定性
item.description:
本周，参加联合国支持的一次重要气候会议的代表们将不得不考虑，如果没有美国政府的参与，他们未来的工作会是什么样子。【原文：

Delegates to a key UN-backed climate meeting this week will be forced to consider what their future work might look like without US government participation.

】

item.title: 英国气象局发布降雨和洪水 "危及生命 "警告
item.description: 气象局发布了黄色天气预警，暴雨和深层洪水可能会造成 "生命危险"。【原文：The Met Office has issued an amber weather warning for heavy rain and deep floodwater that could cause "danger to life".】

item.title: 欧盟委员会建议大幅削减尽职调查指令
item.description: 欧盟委员会建议大幅削弱其最具影响力的环境、社会和治理法规之一。【原文：The European Commission is proposing a significant watering down of what had been one of its most consequential pieces of ESG regulation.】
